Am i missing something ? ( even p = 0, in this case, i should get 100 dolars in 2 year. )  Edit: Nevermind, there is a great answer in math, below in the comments. It explains very well.

Marian Holovatsky If the annual interest rate is p, then if at the beginning of the first year you have m $ at the end you have m $ plus the interest which is m*p $ so in total m + m*p = m * (1 + p) $. At the beginning of the second year you have m * (1 + p) $ so at the end you have m * (1 + p) $ plus the interest which is m * (1 + p) * p $ so in total m * (1 + p) + m * (1 + p) * p = m * (1 + p) * (1 + p) = m * (1 + p)**2. So if m = 1 then at the end of the second year we get (1 + p)**2.
While explained below, the very short answer is "interest on interest".
